h1401.definition: (Aramaic) intensive of {{h1400}}; valiant, or warrior; mighty.

h1402.definition: intensive of {{h1399}}; Gibbar, an Israelite; Gibbar.

h1403.definition: from {{h1397}} and {{h410}}; man of God; Gabriel, an archangel; Garbriel.

h1405.definition: intensive from {{h1389}}; a hilly spot; Gibbethon, a place in Palestine; Gibbethon.

h1406.definition: probably by reduplication from {{h1342}}; a roof; by analogy, the top of an altar; roof (of the house), (house) top (of the house).

h1407.definition: from {{h1413}} (in the sense of cutting); coriander seed (from its furrows); coriander.

h1408.definition: a variation of {{h1409}}; Fortune, a Babylonian deity; that troop.

h1409.definition: from {{h1464}} (in the sense of distributing); fortune; troop.

h1410.definition: from {{h1464}}; Gad, a son of Jacob, including his tribe and its territory; also a prophet; Gad.

h1412.definition: by reduplication from {{h1413}} (in the sense of cutting) cleft; Gudgodah, a place in the Desert; Gudgodah.

h1413.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1464}}); to crowd; also to gash (as if by pressing into); assemble (selves by troops), gather (selves together, self in troops), cut selves.

h1414.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1413}}; to cut down; hew down.

h1415.definition: from an unused root (meaning to cut off); a border of a river (as cut into by the stream); bank.

h1416.definition: from {{h1413}}; a crowd (especially of soldiers); army, band (of men), company, troop (of robbers).

h1417.definition: or גְּדֻדָה; (feminine) from {{h1413}}; a furrow (as cut); furrow.

h1418.definition: feminine participle passive of {{h1413}}; an incision; cutting.

h1419.definition: or גָּדֹל; (shortened) from {{h1431}}; great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent; aloud, elder(-est),   exceeding(-ly),   far, (man of) great (man, matter, thing,-er,-ness), high, long, loud, mighty, more, much, noble, proud thing, × sore, (×) very.

h1420.definition: or גְּדֻלָּה; (shortened) or (less accurately) גְּדוּלָּה; feminine of {{h1419}}; greatness; (concretely) mighty acts; dignity, great things(-ness), majesty.

h1421.definition: or (shortened) גִּדֻּף; and (feminine) גִּדּוּפָהxlit giddûphâh corrected to giddûwphâh; or גִּדֻּפָה; from {{h1422}}; vilification; reproach, reviling.

h1422.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h1442}}; a revilement; taunt.

h1423.definition: from the same as {{h1415}}; a young goat (from browsing); kid.

h1424.definition: from {{h1409}}; fortunate; Gadi, an Israelite; Gadi.

h1425.definition: patronymically from {{h1410}}; a Gadite (collectively) or descendants of Gad; Gadites, children of Gad.

h1426.definition: intensive for {{h1424}}; Gaddi, an Israelite; Gaddi.

h1427.definition: from {{h1409}} and {{h410}}; fortune of God; Gaddiel, an Israelite; Gaddiel.

h1428.definition: or גַּדיָה; the same as {{h1415}}; a river brink; bank.

h1429.definition: feminine of {{h1423}}; a young female goat; kid.

h1430.definition: from an unused root (meaning to heap up); a stack of sheaves; by analogy, a tomb; shock (stack) (of corn), tomb.

h1431.definition: a primitive root; properly, to twist (compare {{h1434}}), i.e.; to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride); advance, boast, bring up, exceed, excellent, be(-come, do, give, make, wax), great(-er, come to... estate,   things), grow(up), increase, lift up, magnify(-ifical), be much set by, nourish (up), pass, promote, proudly (spoken), tower.

h1432.definition: from {{h1431}}; large (literally or figuratively); great, grew.

h1433.definition: from {{h1431}}; magnitude (literally or figuratively); greatness, stout(-ness).

h1434.definition: from {{h1431}} (in the sense of twisting); thread, i.e. a tassel or festoon; fringe, wreath.

h1435.definition: from {{h1431}}; stout; Giddel, the name of one of the Nethinim, also of one of 'Solomon's servants'; Giddel.

h1436.definition: or (prolonged) גְּדַלְיָהוּ; from {{h1431}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has become great; Gedaljah, the name of five Israelites; Gedaliah.

h1437.definition: from {{h1431}}; I have made great; Giddalti, an Israelite; Giddalti.

h1438.definition: a primitive root; to fell a tree; generally, to destroy anything; cut (asunder, in sunder, down, off), hew down.

h1439.definition: from {{h1438}}; feller (i.e. warrior); Gidon, an Israelite; Gideon.

h1440.definition: from {{h1438}}; a cutting (i.e. desolation); Gidom, a place in Palestine; Gidom.

h1441.definition: from {{h1438}}; warlike (compare {{h1439}}); Gidoni, an Israelite; Gideoni.

h1442.definition: a primitive root; to hack (with words), i.e. revile; blaspheme, reproach.

h1443.definition: a primitive root; to wall in or around; close up, fence up, hedge, inclose, make up (a wall), mason, repairer.

h1445.definition: ; the same as {{h1444}}; Geder, a place in Palestine; Geder.

h1446.definition: or (fully) גְּדוֹר; from {{h1443}}; inclosure; Gedor, a place in Palestine; also the name of three Israelites; Gedor.

h1447.definition: from {{h1443}}; a circumvallation; by implication, an inclosure; fence, hedge, wall.

h1448.definition: feminine of {{h1447}}; inclosure (especially for flocks); (sheep-) cote (fold) hedge, wall.

h1449.definition: the same as {{h1448}}; (with the article) Gederah, a place in Palestine; Gederah, hedges.

h1450.definition: plural of {{h1448}}; walls; Gederoth, a place in Palestine; Gederoth.

h1451.definition: patrial from {{h1445}}; a Gederite, or inhabitant of Geder; Gederite.

h1452.definition: patrial from {{h1449}}; a Gederathite, or inhabitant of Gederah; Gederathite.

h1453.definition: dual of {{h1448}}; double wall; Gederothajim, a place in Palestine; Gederothaim.

h1454.definition: probably a clerical error for {{h2088}}; this; this.

h1455.definition: a primitive root; to remove (a bandage from a wound, i.e. heal it); cure.

h1457.definition: a primitive root; to prostrate oneself; cast self down, stretch self.

h1458.definition: another form for {{h1460}}; the back; back.

h1459.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1460}}; the middle; midst, same, there-(where-) in.

h1460.definition: from {{h1342}} (corresponding to {{h1354}}); the back; by analogy, the middle; among, back, body.

h1461.definition: a primitive root; to dig; husbandman.

h1462.definition: from {{h1461}}; the locust (from its grubbing as a larvae); grasshopper, × great.

h1463.definition: of uncertain derivation; Gog, the name of an Israelite, also of some northern nation; Gog.

h1464.definition: a primitive root (akin to {{h1413}}); to crowd upon, i.e. attack; invade, overcome.

h1465.definition: feminine of {{h1460}}; the back, i.e. (by extension) the person; body.

h1466.definition: the same as {{h1465}}; exaltation; (figuratively) arrogance; lifting up, pride.

h1468.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1494}}); properly, to shear off; but used only in the (figuratively) sense of passing rapidly; bring, cut off.

h1469.definition: or (shortened) גֹזָלlemma גזָל missing vowel, corrected to גֹזָל; from {{h1497}}; a nestling (as being comparatively nude of feathers); young (pigeon).

h1470.definition: probably from {{h1468}}; a quarry (as a place of cutting stones); Gozan, a province of Assyria; Gozan.

h1471.definition: rarely (shortened) גֹּי; apparently from the same root as {{h1465}} (in the sense of massing); a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts; Gentile, heathen, nation, people.

h1472.definition: prolonged for {{h1465}}; a body, whether alive or dead; (dead) body, carcase, corpse.

h1473.definition: or (shortened) גֹּלָה; active participle feminine of {{h1540}}; exile; concretely and collectively exiles; (carried away), captive(-ity), removing.

h1474.definition: from {{h1473}}; captive; Golan, a place east of the Jordan; Golan.

h1475.definition: of uncertain derivation; a pit; pit.

h1476.definition: probably from {{h1598}}; protected; Guni, the name of two Israelites; Guni.

h1477.definition: patronymically from {{h1476}}; a Gunite (collectively with article prefix) or descendants of Guni; Gunites.

h1478.definition: a primitive root; to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire; die, be dead, give up the ghost, perish.

h1479.definition: a primitive root; properly, to hollow or arch, i.e. (figuratively) close; to shut; shut.

h1480.definition: from {{h1479}}; a corpse (as closed to sense); body.

h1481.definition: a primitive root; properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather for hostility (as afraid); abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, × surely.

h1482.definition: or (shortened) גֻּר; perhaps from {{h1481}}; a cub (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the lion; whelp, young one.

h1483.definition: the same as {{h1482}}; Gur, a place in Palestine; Gur.

h1484.definition: or (feminine) גֹּרָה; a variation of {{h1482}}; whelp.

h1485.definition: from {{h1481}} and {{h1168}}; dwelling of Baal; Gur-Baal, a place in Arabia; Gur-baal.

h1486.definition: or (shortened) גֹּרָל; from an unused root meaning to be rough (as stone); properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot); lot.

h1487.definition: or rather (by permutation) גִּישׁ; of uncertain derivation; a mass of earth; clod.

h1488.definition: from {{h1494}}; a fleece (as shorn); also mown grass; fleece, mowing, mown grass.

h1491.definition: a primitive root (akin to {{h1468}}); to cut off, i.e. portion out; take.

h1493.definition: patrial from the unused name of a place apparently in Palestine; a Gizonite or inhabitant of Gizoh; Gizonite.

h1494.definition: a primitive root (akin to {{h1468}}); to cut off; specifically to shear a flock or shave the hair; figuratively to destroy an enemy; cut off (down), poll, shave, (sheep-) shear(-er).

h1495.definition: from {{h1494}}; shearer; Gazez, the name of two Israelites; Gazez.

h1496.definition: from {{h1491}}; something cut, i.e. dressed stone; hewed, hewn stone, wrought.

h1497.definition: a primitive root; to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob; catch, consume, exercise (robbery), pluck (off), rob, spoil, take away (by force, violence), tear.

h1498.definition: from {{h1497}}; robbery, or (concretely) plunder; robbery, thing taken away by violence.

h1499.definition: from {{h1497}}; plunder, i.e. violence; violence, violent perverting.. gozal. See {{h1469}}.

h1500.definition: feminine of {{h1498}} and meaning the same; that (he had robbed) (which he took violently away), spoil, violence.
